Overview of Provider

Source: vignettes/provider.Rmd
provider.Rmd
library(provider)


Example: Opt-Out Provider 


nppes_npi(npi = 1114058443)

order_refer(npi = 1114058443)

opt_out(npi = 1114058443)
optex_final
#> # A tibble: 1 × 29
#>   NPI        `Enumeration Type` Name Pr…¹ First…² Middl…³ Last …⁴ Crede…⁵ Gender
#>   <chr>      <chr>              <chr>     <chr>   <chr>   <chr>   <chr>   <chr> 
#> 1 1114058443 Individual         Dr.       David   Lawren… Smith   M.D.    M     
#> # … with 21 more variables: `Enumeration Date` <dttm>,
#> #   `Certification Date` <dttm>, `Last Updated` <dttm>, City <chr>,
#> #   State <chr>, `Postal Code` <chr>, `Telephone Number` <chr>,
#> #   `Fax Number` <chr>, `Location Address` <chr>, `Mailing Address` <chr>,
#> #   Code <chr>, Description <chr>, License <chr>,
#> #   `Opt Out Effective Date` <dttm>, `Opt Out End Date` <dttm>,
#> #   `Refer To Part B` <lgl>, `Refer To Hhas` <lgl>, `Order Dme` <lgl>, …


optex_long <- optex_final |> 
  dplyr::mutate(dplyr::across(dplyr::everything(), as.character)) |> 
  tidyr::pivot_longer(cols = dplyr::everything())


library(downloadthis)

# CSV file
attach_csv <- optex_long |> 
  downloadthis::download_this(
    output_name = "providercsv",
    output_extension = ".csv",
    button_label = "Download CSV",
    button_type = "default",
    has_icon = TRUE,
    icon = "fa fa-save"
  )
# Excel file
attach_excel <- optex_long |> 
  downloadthis::download_this(
    output_name = "providerxlsx",
    output_extension = ".xlsx",
    button_label = "Download Excel",
    button_type = "primary",
    has_icon = TRUE,
    icon = "fa fa-save"
  )

gt_theme_provider <- function(data,...) {
  data |>
  gt::opt_all_caps() |>
  gt::opt_row_striping() |> 
  gt::opt_table_font(
    font = list(
      gt::google_font("Chivo"),
      gt::default_fonts())) |>
    gt::tab_style(
      style = gt::cell_borders(
        sides = "bottom", 
        color = "transparent", 
        weight = gt::px(2)),
      locations = gt::cells_body(
        columns = TRUE,
        rows = nrow(data$`_data`)))  |> 
  gt::tab_options(
    footnotes.multiline = FALSE,
    row.striping.background_color = "#fafafa",
    table_body.hlines.color = "#f6f7f7",
    table.border.top.width = gt::px(3),
    table.border.top.color = "gray",
    table.border.bottom.color = "gray",
    table.border.bottom.width = gt::px(3),
    column_labels.border.top.width = gt::px(3),
    column_labels.border.top.color = "gray",
    column_labels.border.bottom.width = gt::px(3),
    column_labels.border.bottom.color = "black",
    column_labels.background.color = "white",
    data_row.padding = gt::px(3),
    source_notes.multiline = FALSE,
    source_notes.font.size = 12,
    source_notes.border.bottom.color = "black",
    source_notes.border.bottom.width = gt::px(3),
    table.font.size = 16,
    heading.align = "left",
    ...)
}

add_badge <- function(x){
      add_color <- if (x == "Individual") {
        "background: hsl(116, 60%, 90%); color: hsl(116, 30%, 25%);"
        } else if (x == "Organization") {
          "background: hsl(350, 70%, 90%); color: hsl(350, 45%, 30%);"
        } else if (x != "Individual" | x != "Organization") { x 
          }
      div_out <- htmltools::div(
        style = paste("display: inline-block; padding: 2px 12px; border-radius: 15px; font-weight: 600; font-size: 16px;", add_color), x) 
      as.character(div_out) |> gt::html()
}

add_check_xmark <- function(x) {
  add_checkx <- if (x == TRUE) {
    fontawesome::fa("circle-check", prefer_type = "solid", fill = "green", height = "1.5em", width = "1.5em")
    } else if (x == "FALSE") {
    fontawesome::fa("circle-xmark", prefer_type = "solid", fill = "red")
    } else if (x != "Individual" | x != "Organization") { 
      x 
    }
  div_out <- htmltools::div(style = paste("display: inline-block; padding: 2px 12px; border-radius: 15px; font-weight: 600; font-size: 16px;", add_checkx), x) 
      as.character(div_out) |> gt::html()
  }
optex_long |> 
  #dplyr::mutate(value = purrr::map(value, add_badge)) |>
  #dplyr::mutate(value = purrr::map(value, add_check_xmark)) |>
  gt::gt() |> 
  gtExtras::gt_add_divider(columns = "name", style = "dotted") |> 
  gt::cols_label(name = "Label", value = "Value") |> 
  gt::tab_row_group(group = "Important Dates", 
                    rows = name %in% c("Enumeration Date", 
                                       "Certification Date", 
                                       "Last Updated", 
                                       "Opt Out Effective Date", 
                                       "Opt Out End Date",
                                       "Practice Length",
                                       "Opt Out Length")) |> 
  gt::tab_row_group(group = "Eligible to Order & Refer", 
                    rows = name %in% c("Refer To Part B", 
                                       "Refer To Hhas", 
                                       "Order Dme", 
                                       "Order Pmds")) |> 
  gt::tab_row_group(group = "Taxonomy", 
                    rows = name %in% c("Code", 
                                       "Description", 
                                       "License")) |> 
  gt::tab_row_group(group = "Address", 
                    rows = name %in% c("Location Address", 
                                       "Mailing Address", 
                                       "City", 
                                       "State", 
                                       "Postal Code", 
                                       "Telephone Number", 
                                       "Fax Number")) |> 
  gt::tab_row_group(group = "Basic Information", 
                    rows = name %in% c("NPI", 
                                       "Enumeration Type", 
                                       "Name Prefix", 
                                       "First Name", 
                                       "Middle Name", 
                                       "Last Name", 
                                       "Credential", 
                                       "Gender")) |> 
  gt::tab_style(style = list(gt::cell_fill(color = "darkred"), gt::cell_text(color = "white", weight = "bold")), locations = gt::cells_row_groups()) |> 
  gt_theme_provider() |> 
  gt::tab_header(title = "Provider Results for NPI 1114058443",
    subtitle = gtExtras::add_text_img("Report generated with", url = "https://raw.githubusercontent.com/andrewallenbruce/provider/main/pkgdown/favicon/apple-touch-icon-180x180.png", height = 25)) |> 
  #gt::fmt_date(columns = c(value), rows = dplyr::contains("date"), date_style = 5) |> 
  #gtExtras::gt_badge(value, palette = c("Individual" = "red")) |> 
  gt::tab_source_note(attach_csv) |> 
  gt::tab_source_note(attach_excel) |> 

  gt::text_transform(locations = gt::cells_body(columns = c(value), 
                     rows = name %in% c("eligible_to_order_and_refer", 
                                       "refer_partb", 
                                       "refer_hha", 
                                       "order_dme", 
                                       "order_pmd")),
                     fn = function(x) {
                       if (x == as.character("TRUE")) {gt::html(fontawesome::fa("circle-check", prefer_type = "solid", fill = "green", height = "1.5em", width = "1.5em"))
                         } else if (x == as.character("FALSE")) {gt::html(fontawesome::fa("circle-xmark", prefer_type = "solid", fill = "red"))
                         }
                     }
                       )
#> Error in if (x == as.character("TRUE")) {: argument is of length zero


provider_enrollment(npi = 1114058443)
#> Error in `resp_body_raw()`:
#> ! Can not retrieve empty body


Medicare Order and Referring API


Is the provider currently eligible to make referrals to Medicare Part B or a Home Health Agency (HHA)? Order Durable Medical Equipment (DME) or Power Mobility Devices (PMDs)? Search Medicare’s Order and Referring API with provider_moar():


order_refer(npi = 1114058443)
#> # A tibble: 1 × 7
#>          npi last_name first_name partb dme   hha   pmd  
#>        <int> <chr>     <chr>      <lgl> <lgl> <lgl> <lgl>
#> 1 1114058443 SMITH     DAVID      TRUE  TRUE  TRUE  TRUE


Medicare Provider and Supplier Taxonomy Crosswalk API


You may need to find Medicare’s specialty codes for this provider’s taxonomies. Using the output from the NPPES search in the first example, you can search Medicare’s Provider and Supplier Taxonomy Crosswalk API with provider_mpstc():


taxonomy_crosswalk(taxonomy_code = "2084P0800X")
#> # A tibble: 2 × 4
#>   medicare_specialty_code medicare_provider_supplier_type_desc…¹ provi…² provi…³
#>   <chr>                   <chr>                                  <chr>   <chr>  
#> 1 26                      Physician/Psychiatry                   2084P0… Allopa…
#> 2 86                      Physician/Neuropsychiatry              2084P0… Allopa…
#> # … with abbreviated variable names
#> #   ¹​medicare_provider_supplier_type_description, ²​provider_taxonomy_code,
#> #   ³​provider_taxonomy_description_type_classification_specialization


revalidation_date(npi = 1114058443)
#> Error in `resp_body_raw()`:
#> ! Can not retrieve empty body


Providers may need to update their digital contact information in the NPPES system. To check, you can access the CMS Public Reporting of Missing Digital Contact Information API with provider_promdci(). If they appear in the search results, it’s time to update their NPPES contact information:


missing_information(npi = 1114058443)
#> # A tibble: 1 × 3
#>   npi        last_name first_name
#>   <chr>      <chr>     <chr>     
#> 1 1114058443 Smith     David


opt_out(npi = 1114058443)
#> # A tibble: 1 × 14
#>   date       last_updated first_…¹ last_…² npi   speci…³ optou…⁴ optou…⁵ first…⁶
#>   <date>     <chr>        <chr>    <chr>   <chr> <chr>   <chr>   <chr>   <chr>  
#> 1 2022-12-26 11/15/2022   David    Smith   1114… Psychi… 08/15/… 08/15/… 3101 S…
#> # … with 5 more variables: second_line_street_address <chr>, city_name <chr>,
#> #   state_code <chr>, zip_code <chr>, eligible_to_order_and_refer <lgl>, and
#> #   abbreviated variable names ¹​first_name, ²​last_name, ³​specialty,
#> #   ⁴​optout_effective_date, ⁵​optout_end_date, ⁶​first_line_street_address


Using provider_mpop(), you can access Medicare’s Physician & Other Practitioners - by Provider and Service API:


physician_by_service(npi = 1114058443, year = "2020")
#> Error in `resp_body_raw()`:
#> ! Can not retrieve empty body


This API contains data going back to 2013, so you can perform a long-term analysis of a provider’s Medicare data:


purrr::map_dfr(as.character(2013:2020), ~physician_by_service(npi = 1114058443, year = .x)) |> 
  dplyr::group_by(hcpcs_cd, hcpcs_desc) |> 
  dplyr::summarise(
    Benefits = sum(tot_benes),
    Services = sum(tot_srvcs),
    Avg_Billed = janitor::round_half_up(mean(avg_sbmtd_chrg), digits = 2),
    Avg_Allowed = janitor::round_half_up(mean(avg_mdcr_alowd_amt), digits = 2),
    Avg_Payment = janitor::round_half_up(mean(avg_mdcr_pymt_amt), digits = 2)) |> 
  dplyr::ungroup() |> 
  dplyr::rename(HCPCS = hcpcs_cd, 
                "HCPCS Description" = hcpcs_desc,
                "Avg Charge" = Avg_Billed,
                "Avg Allowed" = Avg_Allowed,
                "Avg Payment" = Avg_Payment) |> 
  dplyr::arrange(dplyr::desc(Services)) |> 
  knitr::kable()
#> Error in `map()`:
#> ℹ In index: 1.
#> Caused by error in `resp_body_raw()`:
#> ! Can not retrieve empty body
